intro: Psychotria talbotii, commonly known as the Talbot's Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria talbotii is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its uses.
